ParentCompanyName: QEP Field Services, LLC dba Tesoro Logistics - Ro

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to 40 CFR 68 for Tesoro Logistics Robinson Lake Gas Plant. 

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are addressed in the individual   RMP / PSM procedures which detail the RMP / PSM program requirements as well as how Tesoro Logistics will comply with the applicable requirements. The site is not a responding facility for releases of the RMP listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan.  

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:



Location:

The Stanley Booster Station is located approximately four miles south-southeast of Stanley, North Dakota at the intersection of County Road 22 and 80th Avenue in Mountrail County (Section 14, Township 144N, Range 91W), which is classified as in attainment or unclassifiable for the National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS).



Process Description:

The Stanley Booster Station is located downstream of the Robinson Lake Gas Plant. Gas from the outlet of the Robinson Lake Gas Plant is routed to the inlet of the Stanley Booster Station for further processing, where the pressure is boosted from 700 pounds per square inch, gauge (psig) to 2,000 psig before transferring the gas to various sales outlets. The Stanley Booster Station includes four natural gas-fired compressor engines, a line heater, inlet and utility gas scrubbers, a Joule-Thomson (JT) expansion valve processing skid, and an emergency generator, as well as storage tanks and other equipment to support operation of the station The Stanley Booster Station is permitted to operate under North Dakota Department of Health (NDDH) Permit Number O12008-R1.

 

The general accidental release prevention program an

d chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:





These items, their specific requirements, and how the Robinson Lake Gas Plant will comply with the requirements are addressed in the individual procedural documents.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]: 

No Accidents in the last 5 Years



The Stanley Booster Station is a new RMP facility.



The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

In the event of an emergency, the Stanley Booster Station will notify the Mountrail County LEPC and the local fire departments to respond and will evacuate their employees when needed.  Additional details related to emergency procedures can be located in the facility's emergency action plan.

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
